channel.title: DTO
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from DTO, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Berkshire Hathaway says Buffett will remain chairman when Abel takes CEO reins
Services sector of U.S. economy strengthened in April
Resident ‘Buffettologist’ eyes Berkshire Hathaway’s future — live event at noon
Watch for Powell to push back this week on calls for Fed interest-rate cuts
Berkshire Hathaway shares down 6% at open after Buffett reveals succession plan
Trump takes credit for 'good parts' of economy, blames 'bad parts' on Biden
item.description: Last week, Trump put the onus on Biden for the economy contracting in the first quarter of the year.

item.title: Incoming German Chancellor Merz vows reforms and investments as parties sign coalition agreement
item.description: Germany's incoming Chancellor Friedrich Merz and the country's new cabinet are set to take office Tuesday.

item.title: NPR and PBS CEOs say they'll challenge Trump administration over federal funding cuts
item.description: The CEOs of NPR and PBS said on Sunday's "Face the Nation" they will challenge Trump's executive order to end federal funding to the organizations.

item.title: Trump posts AI-generated photo of himself dressed as the pope
item.description: President Trump earlier this year jokingly called himself a "king" after he moved to end the congestion pricing program in New York City.

item.title: Waltz used Signal-like app at White House day before ouster as national security advisor
item.description: President Trump recently discouraged the use of the Signal app after controversy over a group chat of administration officials detailed military plans...
